title: Sustainability Education Design Based on Flame-Retardant Bamboo

context.prior_knowledge: Basic chemistry concepts and general understanding of environmental sustainability
context.additional_context: A blended learning course for university students integrating chemical properties of flame-retardant bamboo with sustainability concepts. Students use personal devices to access online materials and practical tools, applying mixed research methods and an educational recontextualization model

learning_goals: Students can explain the scientific principles of flame-retardant bamboo and its connection to sustainability through a concept map.
Learners can analyze the chemical properties of ionic liquid flame retardants using experimental data through blended activities.
Students achieve an 85% or higher improvement rate in pre-post self-efficacy surveys.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
